intro: Cupania lachnocarpa, commonly known as the sticky cupuaçu, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by large, edible fruits with a sticky, sweet pulp. The fruit's unique texture and flavor make it a valuable resource in local cuisine and traditional medicine. Its botanical features reflect adaptations to the humid, nutrient-rich environment of the tropical rainforest.
